# Melodic Scale in G# (Mode: Super Locrian, Shape: E)

## Description of the Scale
The Melodic Scale in G# is a versatile and complex scale often used in jazz, fusion, and experimental music. In this specific case, it is in the mode of Super Locrian, also known as the Altered Scale. The shape of this scale is based on the E shape pattern on the guitar, which influences the way the scale is played and the unique sound it produces.

## Notes and Intervals
The G# Melodic Scale in the Super Locrian mode consists of the following notes: G# - A# - B# - C# - D# - F - G. The intervals for this scale are: Root, b9, #9, 3, #11, b13, and b7. These intervals give the scale its dissonant and tense quality.

## Genre and Musical Flavor 
This scale is commonly used in genres like jazz and fusion for its distinct dissonant sound. The Super Locrian mode, with its altered intervals, adds tension and color to musical compositions. It has a dark and mysterious flavor that can evoke a sense of unease or unpredictability in the music.
